results.title: Colbo Nights
results.creator_credit: Dean Lawry, Kim Montgomery and ACMI
results.brief_description: Football practice, barbequed snags and a couple of beers at the pub. This is Thursday night in Colbinabbin and you can meet local characters such as Slab, Meathead and Stewballs. The atmosphere is one of a close knit community that loves sports, live music and supports each other through good times and bad.

results.title: Newstead Community Garden
results.creator_credit: David Withers, Csilla Csongvay and ACMI
results.brief_description: When the town of Newstead held a summit in 2008, the idea of a community garden grew out of it. With the help of a grant and the support of locals and volunteers, the land surrounding the All Saints Anglican Church has become a thriving biodynamic garden. It is a great place for the community to come together, dig and get to know one another.

results.title: Who Gives a Stuff About the Farmer
results.creator_credit: Simon Walshe, Csilla Csongvay and ACMI
results.brief_description: This provocative short documentary combines a song written by JR Williams about the plight of the dairy farmer with images of farmers at work in the Gunbower region. JR was inspired to write this song in response to the pipeline development that is set to take water from the Campaspe area to Melbourne. The song is to inform people, especially those living in the city that farmers are doing it tough and that taking water away from regional towns is not a sustainable solution for the city’s water shortage.

results.title: Leaving My Country
results.creator_credit: Grant Hood, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: An argument with his uncle one night would turn out to be a life-changing experience for Grant Hood, a proud Kurnai Gunai man. Grant mentions the importance of his meeting with Kutcha Edwards when he first arrives in Melbourne. A photo of a very young Kutcha is also shown.

results.title: Looking Back
results.creator_credit: Roberto Salvatore, Csilla Csongvay and ACMI
results.brief_description: Three locals talk about personal histories in the small town of Caramut in regional Victoria. Take a trip down memory lane with Patricia Giles as she talks about soldier settlement and how the town has changed over the years. Tom and Dan Dickson look back on their family history and give us a tour of the town, including a stone bridge their great grandfather built that still stands in Caramut today.

results.title: The Letters from Java
results.brief_description: Eric Peters only knew his dad through what records were left behind. They were mostly letters that came through the censors at a POW camp in Burma and old photos. He reflects on the sadness of not knowing his dad and the importance of bringing his spirit home to rest.

results.title: Orbost Locals
results.creator_credit: Kim Montgomery, David Withers and ACMI
results.brief_description: Learn about the town of Orbost through a diverse range of locals as they talk about why they love their town, their community and the surrounding environment. Meet Mick Colling, the publican of the Orbost Club Hotel, who is heavily involved in fundraising within his local community and in particular for Ronald McDonald House. Lachie Macalister, a ‘true’ local and over eighty years old, has lived and farmed in Orbost all his life, growing everything from potatoes to pumpkins and working the land with pigs and cattle. Heather Terrell is many things: a passionate gardener, volunteer and member of the local historical society. Liz Mitchell, a tree changer and small business owner who decided to move to Orbost because she loved the environment and wanted to raise her family in a rural region. Finally, there’s Sam Mitchell, an 18-year-old student known around town for the extraordinary machines he builds and rides.

results.title: The Whitlands Plateau
results.creator_credit: Csilla Csongvay, Matt Blackwood, ACMI Content Development, Shelley Matulick and ACMI
results.brief_description: Distance is no barrier to this active group of entrepreneurs who have a rich history and a strong community spirit. From lawyers and artists to viticulturists and wine makers, the small plateau in Whitlands, in north-eastern Victoria, attracts a diverse group of talented and hard working professionals. We meet some life-long locals and a newcomer to town and hear about the history of the area as well as the ventures that are being undertaken in 2012 Whitlands.

results.title: This is Mt Best
results.creator_credit: Dean Lawry, Kim Montgomery and ACMI
results.brief_description: Meet the creatures that stir in the hills, forests and hall of Mt Best. The people of Mt Best are a special breed, with their Secret Men’s and Women’s Business and their legend of the Bocce Bird. This is a town that consists of a solitary hall but is a constant, thriving hive of activity. Combined with the breathtaking views, Mt Best is a place of mystery, beauty and laughter.
results.description: Meet the creatures that stir in the hills, forests and hall of Mt Best. The people of Mt Best are a special breed, with their Secret Men’s and Women’s Business and their legend of the Bocce Bird. This is a town that consists of a solitary hall but is a constant, thriving hive of activity. Combined with the breathtaking views, Mt Best is a place of mystery, beauty and laughter.

results.title: Gunbower: Family Albums
results.creator_credit: David Meagher, Csilla Csongvay and ACMI
results.brief_description: This film features life long residents of Gunbower and their family connections to three historically rich properties. From Greg Toll’s ancestral home in Kow Swamp to the Old Butter Factory in the heart of the town to Masters Landing on the shores of the Murray River. Each location resonates with childhood memories of times past.
